p: In addition, it was determined that citronellol and carveol had a strong inhibitory effect over the growth of E. coli because these EO can interact with the cell wall components such as the membrane proteins, which will lead to disturbance in cell wall integrity [ 51]. Properties of certain compounds permit the ability of inhibiting the growth of most Gram-positive bacteria and a few Gram-negatives. This is explained by the outer structure of Gram-positive bacteria, which contains a thick peptidoglycan cell wall that allows penetration by hydrophobic compounds.
